OrgName.entry: SHEFFIELD CITY COUNCIL SMALL GRANTS FUND

AltName.entry: SHEFFIELD CITY COUNCIL GRANT AID (FORMER NAME)

Desc.entry: A simple, fast track grant scheme for projects that want to make a difference in their local community. Keen to fund small voluntary, community and self-help projects run by and for local people. Prioritises activities that: promote community cohesion, reduce social exclusion and inequalities, promote community well-being and active citizenship. Projects can apply for any amount up to £4,000 in a year and do not need to have a formal constitution or be a registered charity to apply but do need to have a bank account in the name of the group. The fund does not give grants for food, costs for the benefit of individuals or groups with large unrestricted funds or a high annual income. Also administers the Strengthening Communities Small Grants Fund which offers up to £3,000 for projects that encourage and develop dialogue between communities, promote cohesion and challenge extremism; the First Steps Fund for Older People which makes grants of up to £500 to new groups and existing groups undertaking new activities for older people; t and the Kids Can Do Fund for positive activities for 8-13 year olds (see separate entry).
